cases.title: Conjugation of full-length fibrils
cases.description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6rbli","text":"Conjugation of full-length fibrils with pHrodo/Alexa dyes/BODIPY-FL NHS ester","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":68,"length":9,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2of78","text":"7 steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ln8u","text":"1. Dissolve 100 ug of dye in 50 ul of sterile DMSO (2 mg/mL) 
2. Dilute fibrils to 1mg/mL concentration in PBS containing 0.1M bicarbonate (total volume: 0.95 mL)
3. Add 50 ug of dissolved dye to each reaction tube
4. Incubate overnight in eppendorf tube (foil-wrapped) with continuous shaking
5. In the morning, spin down the dye-fibril solution at 10,000 g for 10 min at 10C
6. Transfer the supernatant and dissolve the pellet with 1 mL of PBS (repeat 5 times)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Then, perform a quality control check to ensure the size distribution and concentration are corresponding to values outlined in the protocol attached.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kaa0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e13ea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cibio","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":95379,"title":"Preparation of mouse and human α-synuclein fibrils","title_html":"Preparation of mouse and human α-synuclein fibrils","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"preparation-of-mouse-and-human-synuclein-fibrils-c9dtz26n","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7r7btucf.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7r7btucf.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Arpine Sokratian","affiliation":"Duke Univeristy","affiliation_url":null,"username":"arpine-sokratian","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/011.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":13},"type_id":1,"guid":"A1BFDAF7A186473A85F3C50CA4D695D2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1obq1","text":"Evaluated sonicated fibrils should be diluted in PBS to concentration of 2 mg/mL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fap1j","text":"Prepare serial dilutions with dilution factor of 2 in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"o5a9","text":"Once dilutions of fibrils are prepared, thaw down the frozen aliquots of amyloid dyes in water-bath set at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cco6r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"42","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v0kg","text":"Dilute amyloid dyes in PBS to 100 uM concentration (volume 2-3 mL in 15 mL falcon tubes). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7j7lr","text":"IMPORTANT: Dyes need to be diluted after all other reagents are ready","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bj9cp","text":"Add 5 ul of dyes for each replicate/ dilution accounted for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ttcc","text":"IMPORTANT: Spin down the covered 384-well plate loaded with the dyes before moving on to the next step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4370DCAD341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Corning® 384-well Black/Clear Bottom Low Flange Ultra-Low Attachment Microplate Bulk Packed","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"4588","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":null,"vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.corning.com/worldwide/en.html","name":"Corning"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2ql9","text":"Once 5 uL of diluted dyes have been added to the 384-well plate, add the fibril/protein to the dye-preloaded wells. As a standard curve, we optionally use BSA fibrils or standard recombinant sonicated a-synuclein fibrils (starting from 5 mg/mL concentration)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"194ai","text":"Cover the plate with a sealing foil. Spin down the plate at 500g for 30 sec. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7avvc","text":"The program should include the incubation period of 5 min at continuous shaking at 200 rpm. Fluorescence intensity is recorded with excitation/emission spectra set at 468-15/510-20 for FBS, 535-20/585-30 for nile red and 448-10/482-10 nm for ThT. Monomeric mouse and human a-synuclein monomers should be used as a controls (include blank well with PBS as well). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"efca8","text":"Extrapolate the results by subtracting the average blank value. Then, correlate these adjusted results with the standard curve. Ensure that the extrapolated values fall within the appropriate range of the standard curve.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
